law.catch_line: The Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners may not issue any license to sell alcoholic beve...

text.section: The Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners may not issue any license to sell alcoholic beverages within 300 feet of any school, church or other place of worship. The said 300 feet are measured from the nearest point of the building of the proposed establishment to the nearest point of the building of the school, church or other places of worship. Nothing in this section shall apply to or affect or prohibit, in any manner, the renewal or transfer of any license of any establishment where, subsequent to the original granting of said license a school or church building was erected within 300 feet.

This provision shall not apply to:
The issuance of special and temporary licenses; or
A transfer for the purpose of moving the licensed premises within the same building or structure, a transfer of ownership of the same premises, or the renewal of any one of the following alcoholic beverages licenses, provided the license is issued for use on premises with a seating capacity for more than 50 persons and located within a town center:
A Class B beer, wine and liquor on-sale license; or
A 7-day Class BDR (deluxe restaurant) on-sale beer, wine and liquor license.
